name: Definitions Catalogue

subpages.title: Getting Started
subpages.markdown: The Definitions Catalogue REST API allows you to search and browse for data definitions used by the Australian Government.

subpages.title: Base URL
subpages.markdown:
All URLs referenced in the documentation have the following base:

>https://definitions.ausdx.io/api/

The Definitions Catalogue API is served over both HTTP and HTTPS.

subpages.title: OpenAPI specification
subpages.markdown:
The OpenAPI / Swagger documentation for the API is [here](/swagger-ui/index.html?url=https://definitions.ausdx.io/swagger.json)

Here's an automatically generated class diagram of the service.

[![Generated class diagram from swagger](https://graph.ausdx.io/swagger.svg?url=https://definitions.ausdx.io/swagger.json)](https://graph.ausdx.io/swagger.svg?url=https://definitions.ausdx.io/swagger.json)

Click for bigger version


We try to keep it up to date, but the documentation you're reading is you're best bet and understanding the API.

subpages.title: Authentication
subpages.markdown:
This API is 100% public.

There is no Authentication

subpages.title: HATEOS
subpages.markdown:
Most of the resources returned the API follow the HATEOS approach: links are provided to help you navigate around.

This API uses HATEOS for things like:
- paging
- getting specific details about defintions

HATEOS in this API follows this general pattern:

```json
{
    "content": { ... the resource data ...},
    "links": [
        {
            "rel": "a_name_for_the_link",
           "href": "a_link_to_related_things"
         },
         ... more rels/hrefs ...
    ]
}
```

subpages.title: Paging
The web version
subpages.markdown:
There is a [web version of the catalogue](https://definitions.ausdx.io) that mirrors the functionality of this API.

In general, the API uri's follow the same pattern as the web ones but with the '/api/' path segment removed.

For example:

- [http://definitions.ausdx.io/definition/other/de55](http://definitions.ausdx.io/definition/other/de55) <-- the web version
- [http://definitions.ausdx.io/api/definition/other/de55](http://definitions.ausdx.io/api/definition/other/de55) <-- the api version

So to get an easy head start on what you can do wit the API, head over to the web version and take a look.

subpages.title: Rate Limiting
subpages.markdown:
At the moment there is no imposed rate limiting.

We'll monitor the service and impose limiting if it has trouble keeping up.

subpages.title: Search
Examples
subpages.markdown:
Here is an example call that searches for the words 'motor vehicle' in all domains:

```json
http://definitions.ausdx.io/api/search?query=motor%20vehicle
```

And and example speficying a domain:
```json
http://http://definitions.ausdx.io/api/search?query=motor%20vehicle&domain=fs
```

And an example with paging

```json
http://definitions.ausdx.io/api/search?query=motor+vehicle&domain=fs&page=1&size=20
```

subpages.title: Synonyms
subpages.markdown:
We will include any results that have [synonyms](http://definitions.ausdx.io/synonyms) from your search query.

We want to make the synonym list better, so contact us if you have updates.

subpages.title: Browse
subpages.markdown:
The base URL for the browse service is:

>http://definitions.ausdx.io/api/definitions


In addition to the [paging](Using%20the%20API#Paging) parameters, search uses the following:

The `domain` query parameter specifies a domain to browse within.

If you don't provide a value for `domain`, the definitons from all domains will be browsed.

More information about domains, and the values the parameter takes is [here](Domains).
